title: Ticket #3195: Maximize use of shared fs in the blahp
description:
The blahp has code to determine when it can rely on a shared filesystem and when it has to employ explicit file transfer requests in the underlying batch system. This is done in the function bls_test_shared_dir() in blah_common_submit_functions.sh. This function always says relative pathnames cannot be accessed via a shared filesystem. As a result, if the ad given to the blahp by Condor contains a relative path, explicit file transfers are used even when they aren't necessary. This is a problem for SGE and some flavors of PBS, where file transfers by the batch system aren't supported.

To fix this, we can change bls_setup_all_files() in blah_common_submit_functions.sh to always use absolute paths when calling bls_test_shared_dir(). Relative filenames are relative to the job's Iwd.
